title.value: Immunization Evaluation Dose Status Reason codes

description.value: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the reason why an administered dose has been assigned a particular status. Often, this reason describes why a dose is considered invalid. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

copyright.value: This material derives from the HL7 Terminology (THO). THO is copyright Â©1989+ Health Level Seven International and is made available under the CC0 designation. For more licensing information see: https://terminology.hl7.org/license

definition.value: The full volume of the dose was not administered to the patient.
The vaccine experienced a cold chain break.
The vaccine was recalled by the manufacturer.
The vaccine experienced adverse storage conditions.
The vaccine was expired at the time of administration.
The vaccine was administered in a manner that is inconsistent with the evaluated schedule.
